attributes.action: Increase government funding for child abuse organisations and therapy services.
attributes.background:
Thousands of children everyday are being abused, in the UK.  
How can we as citizens do nothing to help the vulnerable children being tormented?  How can we let the dreams of the youth be destroyed?
 They will be OUR FUTURE! YOU can make a difference by signing this petition.
attributes.additional_details:
-There are currently over 57,000 children identified as needing protection from abuse in the UK
-For every child identified as needing protection from abuse, another 8 are suffering abuse. 
https://www.nspcc.org.uk/services-and-resources/research-and-resources/statistics/

Remember YOU can help change their lives. So, support this cause.

attributes.action: All car drivers should be made to do a CPC course like professional drivers.
attributes.background: Driving on today's roads are very challenging and dangerous, when I was recently in a speeding awareness course, 19 out of 20 people where totally clueless about lots of rules and regulations from the highway code, everybody must be retrained for everybody's safety

attributes.action: Penalties for those who park in parent-toddler spaces without children
attributes.background: As a father of two children and a driver, I find it hugely ignorant of those who find it acceptable to park in parent-toddler spaces when they do not have children. There are penalities for parking in a disabled space incorrectly so why not the same for parent-toddler spaces?

attributes.action: I want to lower the abortion limit
attributes.background: A baby is a baby from conception but more so knowing it's got a heartbeat at 6-7 weeks. 24 weeks a baby is developed it can survive. I don't agree that a baby can be born before 24 weeks and they won't save it but as soon as it's over 24 weeks they will fight to save the baby.
attributes.additional_details: The abortion limit needs to be lowered to below 12 weeks!!

attributes.action: Speed up DBS checks
attributes.background: Care companies are in crisis due to the waiting time for DBS checks. Staff only have to give a months notice to leave  but to get new staff to cover them can take months, It is hard enough getting staff to work in the care industry and many give up the wait after 4 weeks as need to be in paid work.

attributes.action: Stop outsourcing assessments for PIP and make fit for Mental Health sufferers.
attributes.background: The current assessment trivialises common issues like depression and anxiety and does not take these into consideration when deciding these claims. The form and the assessor only consider physical ailments and not how mental ability often prevent physical ability and is tantamount to discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: ATOS Healthcare also often misrepresent an individuals needs and conversations they have had during PIP assessments and this has been well documented in the press and many websites previously. Here are a couple of examples: http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/new-claims-of-atos-assessment-lies-are-tip-of-a-massive-iceberg/ and http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/atos-nurse-lied-about-pip-claimant-attending-assessment-alone/

attributes.action: Assure that the Banbury Horton General Hospital stays open as Oxford is too far!
attributes.background: In writing this as a ambulance practitioner I am solely concerned with patients care as for a seriously ill patient or one in cardiac arrest yo be conveyed from Banbury and surrounding area all the way to Oxford would assuredly kill them we must protect Horton Hospital as a local Banbury resource!!!
attributes.additional_details: See NHS statistics and the resuscitation councils standards for early access in cardiac arrest and cardiac event cases and or cva's/stroke victims time every single second counts

attributes.action: A standard internet speed of 24 megabits per second (Mbps) for the UK.
attributes.background: In the 21st Century our lives are dependent on the internet; while in Dorset, Eng we have to depend on 0.64 Mbps download. This is humiliatingly far behind other nations' and insufficient to even stream a film. Therefore, we propose a minimum speed of 24 Mbps that will ensure fair speeds for the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some examples of the poor speeds from across the UK:

http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/38067272/autumn-statement-five-places-you-say-need-better-broadband-around-the-uk

In rural Dorset: http://www.speedtest.net/my-result/5904028990

http://www.techdigest.tv/2016/12/4g-coverage-better-in-peru-than-britain-says-damning-report-from-lord-adonis.html

http://www.telecomstechnews.com/news/2016/dec/20/uk-14-million-premises-lack-decent-broadband-connections-finds-ofcom/

attributes.action: Introduce a phased ban on multiple point fishing hooks for all leisure angling
attributes.background: For future generations, the welfare and conservation of all native fish species will benefit from a phased UK ban on multiple point hooks for all leisure (sea, coarse and game) angling. This petition proposes to change government policy, restricting anglers to using one single fishing hook per rod.
attributes.additional_details: Leisure angling is one of our biggest recreational pastimes. Whether as a requirement or personal preference, fish should be returned to the water quickly and unharmed. Whilst conservation measures, including a ban on lead weights, help to protect native fish and other wildlife, leisure angling’s use of multiple point hooks remains its Achilles heel. Removal is more time consuming, increases fish stress and the likelihood of harm or death. There are no grounds for defending multiple point hooks.

attributes.action: Help victims of domestic abuse: make collect and pay child maintenance mandatory
attributes.background: When you are a victim of domestic abuse, you want no contact with the other parent. However, if you ask to do the collect and pay which means no contact, the paying parent can choose to decline and decide to have direct pay, which means contact and they get your bank account details: control again.
attributes.additional_details: The new Child Maintenance Service risks putting parents back into domestic abuse by making them give the other parent their bank account details. This also allows them to put any reference on the payment which shows on your bank account statements.

attributes.action: Compulsory for all non UK residents/visitors to have Gov't run comp medical ins
attributes.background: I've just read about the NHS being £30m in debt to medical tourism and this is isn't the first time I've read about the strain on the NHS from non residents coming here for the maternity/cancer/medical care.Gov needs to operate a scheme for all visitors to have comp care cover before admittance
attributes.additional_details: Please see 120 individual NHS Trust accounts for the amount owed individually for medical tourism.

attributes.action: Stop Corporation tax cuts and put the Money into Social Care.
attributes.background: £4.6 BILLION in corporation tax cuts is currently being planned by the Tory Party.   Yesterday, Wednesday 14th Dec, in the last Prime ministers question time of the year,  Jeremy Corbyn MP appealed for the £4.6b in corporation tax cuts be put into Social care instead to help solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
The Tory government has cut Social Care and the PM, cabinet, and everybody else knows the effects of these cuts.This crisis is a difficult one for many elderly people because it is also a crisis for the NHS. Those people who are in hospital cannot be discharged because there is nowhere else for them to go. The crisis affects individuals, families and The NHS. 

References
https://youtu.be/p_gl4Z-PJTk

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/m.huffpost.com/uk/entry/uk_585149c8e4b08b39538f4bf0/amp

https://www.politicshome.com/news/uk/politics/news/81735/live-prime-ministers-questions-141216

attributes.action: Amend the Trade Union Act 2016 to remove trade union immunity from damages.
attributes.background: RMT & ASLEF have been striking for no discernible aim other than to cause harm to the commuters that use Southern Rail. They have wreaked untold costs upon individuals, families & businesses, yet they have legal immunity from the laws that govern every other person & organisation in the country.
attributes.additional_details:
This advantage that gives unions legal immunity from any claims for damages arising from their behaviour, however destructive, is wrong. Even the government has been taken to court by an individual before being allowed to invoke article 50, yet someone that loses their job because of persistent union action has no recourse to the courts, it is unjust and unfair. 

Unjustifiable strikes must stop, unfair advantages must stop.
 
Please help to get the Trade Union Act 2016 amended and remove the unfair trade union immunity from damages.

attributes.action: Create a report on cannabis legalisation worldwide
attributes.background:
Cannabis is being legalised and regulated worldwide, for recreational and medicinal use.

We need a full, detailed report which uses up to date science on any health benefits from cannabis and that also looks at the varying models of regulation of cannabis worldwide.

attributes.action: Make driving 25mph or more UNDER the speed limit a punishable offence.
attributes.background: When driving on dual carriage ways or 50mph A roads getting stuck behind drivers who are driving at a speed significantly slower than the speed limit set is a common occurence. It causes unnecessary over taking and can potentially be as dangerous as someone speeding. It needs to be addressed.

attributes.action: Provide New Zealand with aid to help them rebuild after the earthquake.
attributes.background: In light of the two earthquakes that have just hit the New Zealand south island on 13th Nov, the British Government should provide aid to assist the government and people of New Zealand to rebuild their infrastructure. The money should come from the overseas aid budget

attributes.action: Bring 'Hands-on' STEM Back to Schools
attributes.background: As a STEM Educator and STEM Charity Owner, a important issue has come to light, that a lot of 'Hands-on' STEM skills have been stripped from young people's STEM education, leading to a large skill short-fall when student's carry on studying STEM subjects at university.
attributes.additional_details: Information about this subject has been collected and analysed by volunteers at GlamSci (www.GlamSci.org) whom are a non-profit STEM educational charity concerned with young people's education and rights to STEM subjects. This view is backed by current educational figures gathered by STEM governing bodies, universities and other educational organisations.

attributes.action: Prevent companies from defaulting the 'save payment information' on a website
attributes.background: Typically when purchasing online goods, companies by default check the 'Save these payment details'. Saving payment details online isn't a good thing and whilst the option should be there, it shouldn't be defaulted. This should be addressed and could potentially save people from fraudulent purchases
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was the victim of fraud as I may have mistakenly saved my payment card details on a website that was later compromised.

attributes.action: Update the infrastructure for Army families in Woolwich
attributes.background: The soldiers & their families in Woolwich living in Service Family Accommodation don't enjoy Fibre Broadband despite surrounding areas being connected. Internet is used to stay in touch with loved ones (deployed) and it's a disgrace that for economic reasons infrastructure is left outdated.
attributes.additional_details: All parties in relation to the issue have been contacted with no result so far in 2 years. BT and Virgin cannot make a business case and the MoD told us residents need to self-fund fibre. Self funding however is not an option for a large portion of soldier families being attached to The Vikings, who re-locate every 5 years! The council has no jurisdiction. We've been left to struggle with inconceivably slow broadband surrounded by private housing with fibre access, in a London suburb in zone 4.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to close St Bart's Hospital, Rochester, Kent.
attributes.background: There is a lack of provisions in the Medway Towns as it is and we need this hospital. It was used as a rehab hospital for stroke patients and anyone else who needed a longer stay in the hospital. Medway Maritime Hospital will only allow people to stay short term as they need the beds.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a brief history of the hospital; this is one of the oldest hospitals in Britain, having been founded in 1078 by Gundulph, Bishop of Rochester, for the "poor and leprous". The current hospital building in New Road, Rochester was built in 1861.  The hospital relied on charity donations until 1948 when it was funded by the NHS.

We don't want this historic building to end up in the wrong hands because they may demolish this gothic style building and a piece of Medway history will be gone!

attributes.action: Give self-build eco-homes by local families automatic planning permission.
attributes.background: We live in a village and have outgrown our home. We bought a corner of a field close to the village centre to build an affordable Eco-home. This year 278 homes have been approved for building on fields within 2 miles of our site by commercial builders. Ours was refused. It's a double standard.
attributes.additional_details: Local Planning Authorities are supposed to be supporting self-builds, eco-homes, affordable homes and local people. Our LPA refused our application even though no measurable harm was established. High-impact commercial developments with big numbers of homes are favoured. This is wrong and is holding back the solution to the housing supply shortfall.

attributes.action: Make it Law for drivers involved in a accident to report to police at the scene
attributes.background: Drivers are able to leave the scene of an accident and be within the law to report it within 24 hours, therefore police are unable to take correct alcohol and drug samples, giving a possible lighter sentence.
attributes.additional_details: Ben regan was killed by a driver who failed to stop and drove home and hid the car, and called the police 10 hours after, to plead not guilty to a careless driving charge due to lack of evidence. Family's are being put through hell because of this loophole. It must be stopped.

attributes.action: Make it an arrest-able offence for protesters to obstruct roads of any kind
attributes.background: As people are aware protesters come in all different forms and from different beliefs. For those who chose to protest in roads whether it be a side road, entrance to a work sight, or a main road. This is petition is to help make it an arrest-able offence to block roads of any kind.
attributes.additional_details:
Helping stop protesters obstructing roads and access of the road; by making it an arrest-able offence to cause obstruction or disruption too any road of any kind.
This could help prevent companies suing or losing business and increase awareness for road safety and the dangers of protesters using main roads or side roads of any kind.

attributes.action: Eliminate residency requirements when determining a British Citizens fee status
attributes.background: As a British citizen, one can expect fair and just treatment in their country; one should not be treated any differently than fellow Britons. Currently, a citizen must live in the UK for the 3 year before starting a university course, which discriminates against citizens who live abroad.
attributes.additional_details: With the current fee status terms, many British citizens are classified as international students when returning to their home. Not only are international fees extortionate, this means that a citizen is treated no differently than a foreigner when they are in their own country. These fees may even impede a citizen from returning home. In order to end this discrimination, fee status should be based upon citizenship; a Briton should be considered a Briton, regardless of where s/he has lived.

attributes.action: To create separate employment laws for big businesses & micro/small businesses.
attributes.background: Corporate law does not recognise that small business cannot afford to offer the same 'rights' as big business, such as lengthy paid maternity/paternity leave etc. However, it can offer a more rewarding work environment, where every employee is an individual who is vitally important to the business.
attributes.additional_details: Because every person counts in a small business, it cannot afford to lose an employee for extended periods and pay cover. But by choosing to work in a micro/small business, employees could opt for shorter paid maternity/paternity leave, fewer paid sick days etc. in exchange for other benefits such as greater flexibility in working time & time off. Plus an environment where each employee is vitally important to the success of the business and there is greater equality between the boss and staff.

attributes.action: Allow the continued use of A2 motorcycle restrictor kits.
attributes.background: The plan to prohibit current use of A2 restrictor kit seems unfair to a lot of riders as this is a step up for their current A1 licence restricting the to 125cc motorcycles. The UK is one of the strictest if not the strictest when it comes to motorcycle laws,this is a step in the wrong direction.

attributes.action: Halt the Department of Education's Autumn Census & destroy all data collected.
attributes.background: The Department of Education's Autumn Census expects parents to disclose their children Country of Birth and state 'National Identity' from a list of Welsh, English, Scottish, Irish, British, Other, or Refuse. Parents should not be asked to determine and disclose the national identity of children.

attributes.action: Justice for children. Tougher prison sentences for paedophiles, 15 years minimum
attributes.background: Paedophiles are protected by an out of date legal system. They are protected in prison and given a new identity once free. A paedophile or sex offender never truly faces their disgusting crimes, while the children and families have to deal with it forever.
attributes.additional_details: Paedophiles should be forced to mix with the general population of a prison - why should they be kept safe? A child will never be able to forget what they have been through, while the paedophiles are set free after a few years to do it to another child. How can parents protect their children from a paedophile when they are so well hidden?

attributes.action: Make it law that animals microchips come with a tracking device
attributes.background: Get these dogs and cats safe by having a microchip with a tracker in it and then people can locate their pets when they go missing

attributes.action: Stop the capture and collection of live, wild caught wrasse.
attributes.background: The taking of wild ballan wrasse to use within the cage culture of salmonid species is detrimental to the UK coastal environment. It takes on average 6 years for a ballan to reach sexual maturity and collecting and taking them from the wild can have long term negative impacts.

attributes.action: Make maternity pay your full pay for the entirety of your maternity leave.
attributes.background: I am on maternity leave at the moment and I know a lot of other people are too. We are all really struggling to make ends meet with the statutory maternity pay. We have all applied for the benefits we are entitled to, we either get rejected or its just not enough and we are all struggling.

attributes.action: REMOVE  all restrictions from the £100,000 Transferable Main Residence Tax(RNRB)
attributes.background:
The RNRB, an addition to the IHT allowance, states this property allowance is only exempt from IHT if the property is bequeathed to a direct descendant of the deceased, or their spouse/civil partner.
For RNRB purposes common law partners or relatives such as nephews,nieces,siblings are exempt.
attributes.additional_details:
INSTEAD give the allowance restriction free, to all property owners,  enabling them to bequeath as much of their main residence free from IHT as possible.
This would increase the  current £325,000 IHT threshold by £100,000. Increasing to £500,000 by 2020.This then can be bequeathed to anybody you choose
See https://www.gov.uk/wills-probate-inheritance/overview. Select IHT go to item 2,

attributes.action: Make sexual harassment punishable with a fine or prison sentence.
attributes.background: Currently within the UK, at least 90% of women have experienced some form of sexual harassment before the age of 17. Sexual harassment is not has emotionally damaging affects but it continually exacerbates the ideal that men have power over women and impedes women's societal right to be equal to men
attributes.additional_details: Sexual harassment can range from anything from "cat calling" and "wolf whistling" to inappropriate physical contact and unwanted sexual advances. So many women nowadays feel as though they are unable to report it but it has profound psychological and social effects on women every day. It continues to objectify women even to this day. Due to the little reports our national figures are majorly unrepresentative of the life women live daily. Enough is enough. Stand with the 2010 Equality Act.

attributes.action: 45p/mile Mileage Allowance Payment for walking or cycling for business journeys
attributes.background: The current permitted Mileage Allowance Payment for business travel for the first 10,000 miles for bicycles are less than half the allowance for cars, while there is no tax refund for walking to your local business meeting instead of taking your car.
attributes.additional_details: This would encourage businesses to adopt greener transport and does not need expensive infrastructure and costly enforcement departments.  Firstly, it would incentivise employees to walk or cycle instead of taking their cars for very short journeys; thereby increasing national physical activity levels, improving health, and reducing obesity rates. Secondly, it could reduce the number of vehicles used for short business journeys; thereby reducing congestion and reducing pollution.

attributes.action: Standardisation of community first responders in the united kingdom.
attributes.background: Community First Responders are members of the public, trained by the Ambulance Service Trusts, who volunteer their time to respond to 999 calls on behalf of Ambulance Service Trusts throughout the UK. They provide medical and life saving help to patients in emergency situations.
attributes.additional_details:
That First Responders are formally recognised and known as “Ambulance First Responders” by all Ambulance Service Trusts.
That all First Responders are permitted to bear the title “Ambulance First Responder” on their uniforms and response vehicles.
That all First Responders are permitted to wear uniforms in the same green colours of Ambulance Services Trust personnel while responding.
Training is reviewed and standardised across the all Ambulance Services Trusts in the UK.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for any school to detain SEN Children after school
attributes.background: As a mum of an SEN Child and a person that works in a school, I feel passionately about this. SEN children, whatever their needs, have had enough to cope with after 6 hours at school. They have worked 4 times as hard as the other kids.

attributes.action: Do urgent studies into Cannabis Oil for cures for Cancer,back pain other illness
attributes.background: Last year I was taking 8 morphine tablets a day, I starting using Cannabis Oil, NOT NOW, when I was taking it, my pain managment went to 1 tablet at night. My dear friend now has cancer and this could cure her and millions more with many illnesses. Please do an INDEPENDENT REPORT on Cannabis Oil.

attributes.action: Require visas for visitors to the UK & add a fee if they've no health insurance.
attributes.background: The fees raised for the visas should be used to off set the cost to the NHS for providing treatment to the visitors.

attributes.action: Stop the Closure of West Cumberland Hospital
attributes.background: The closure of West Cumberland Hospital in Whitehaven is imminent. The maternity unit & others are affected. It is 30 miles to Barrow & 40 miles to Carlisle Hospital. It has been reported that patients have died in transit to either hospital. How can the NHS justify this.
attributes.additional_details: They have built a new hospital at the rear of the old West Cumberland Hospital but are now closing certain sections down. The new MP for Copeland needs to fight this closer & back the people of Whitehaven. I urge you to sign the petition & stop the closure of the only hospital within a 30 miles radius.

attributes.action: Bring in a standard size/height for speed bumps so cars can be designed to suit
attributes.background:
Speed bumps vary in height and width all over the country. 
Bringing in a standard will allow car manufacturers to design cars to suit. This will not just be cost effective but also safer for pedestrians.

attributes.action: UK government immediately withdraw support for the Kiev regime.
attributes.background: Since 2014, when a coup occurred in Ukraine, Britain has steadily increased its military and logistical support for the regime.
attributes.additional_details:
It has been reported that the UK government has deployed 650 troops on "secret" operations in Ukraine in support of the coup regime. The Daily Mail* recently reported that the UK government is also deploying naval vessels to the Black Sea to support them. This is open hostility against the people of Donbass, who have a right to a democratic government, removed from them by the coup. 
 * http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4167612/HMS-Putin-Hunter-sends-Royal-Navy-ship-Black-Sea.html

attributes.action: Tougher punishment for crimes against teens/adults with autism/mental health.
attributes.background: I am sick and tired of reading about teens and adults being targeted and on occasions killed because they are vulnerable and an easy target, they may have mental health issues/autism/learning difficulties but they are human and have enough in their lives to deal with without being attacked.
attributes.additional_details:
My son is 16 and has Autism, I worry every day about him being bullied, assaulted or attacked because of his disability.

I read an article recently that truly sickened/shocked and upset me that there are human beings out there that think it's ok to tie a teenager with special needs upside down from a tree and beat them to death, words truly fail me.

Punishment for this type of crime is too lenient, especially for teenagers who think it's a laugh to publicly humiliate vulnerable/disabled people.

Teens and adults with Autism, learning difficulties and mental health issues should feel safe and protected as not all of them have a 24hr carer or a guardian angel watching over them all of the time.

Please sign this petition and keep the vulnerable safe.

attributes.action: Condemn the murderous attacks on the elected Leader of the Bakongo people.
attributes.background: The mandate of the current government expired on 19 December 2016. After 16 years Hyppolite Kanambe alias Joseph Kabila refuses to relinquish power and must be held accountable for the murder of un-armed civilians by Police and soldiers ultimately under his control.
attributes.additional_details: There is photographic evidence of the slaughter of un-armed civilians at the residence of The Honourable Muanda Nsemi  an elected government deputy. Currently his home is under siege with all amenities cut. At his residence there are the elderly, women and children who went there to pray. I have information that the situation is deteriorating and risks to human life is high. We want the International community to intervene to save the lives of the People of Congo. It is Imperative to act now.

attributes.action: Introduce and enforce a trade embargo on Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia have an appalling human rights record. Homosexual acts are punishable by death and women are treated legally as second class citizens. In addition to their medieval society, there is evidence that the Saudi regime funds Sunni terrorists organisations. We cannot do business with them.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/saudi-arabia/local-laws-and-customs
"The Saudi legal system differs in many ways from the UK. Suspects can be held without charge and are not always allowed quick access to legal representation. The Saudi authorities have detained witnesses and victims of crimes."
"It is illegal for women to drive."
"The public practice of any form of religion other than Islam is illegal"

attributes.action: Ban gambling and live odds advertising during sports broadcasts.
attributes.background: With the explosion of the Premier League, a similar and more sinister growth has taken place, that of online gambling. A gambling addiction can ruin families and lives and with smartphones accessible 24/7, it has never been easier to gamble.
attributes.additional_details: The government has banned smoking adverts yet betting companies are still allowed to advertise, with a 600% increase from 2006-2012 and children as young as 4 being exposed to 200 adverts a year. This creates a sense that gambling is part of life and everybody is doing it whereas in reality it can become dangerous. We are not asking for a ban on gambling, all we want is to separate the enjoyment of sport from the dangers of gambling, by banning gambling adverts during the broadcast of sport.

attributes.action: Give early years teachers (with EYTS) the same rights for pay as those with QTS.
attributes.background: EYTs have to pass the same skills test and interviews to qualify onto the course, and meet and pass against the same amount of standards and assessments as those with QTS. Therefore rights for starting pay should be the same, and the professionalism of the early years should be further recognised.
attributes.additional_details: Get into teaching (https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/funding-and-salary/teacher-salaries) states 'As a newly qualified teacher you’ll begin on a salary of at least £22,467, or £28,098 in inner London. As you rise up the pay ranges, you could earn as much as £115,582 as a head...' However on the same web page it states an unqualified teacher can receive a minimum of £16,461. Early Years Teachers are currently viewed as 'unqualified' despite the vigorous post graduate year training.

attributes.action: Don't jail journalists for publishing documents deemed harmful to the economy
attributes.background: Under new proposals for an Espionage Act to replace the Official Secrets Act journalists could be jailed for 14 years for obtaining or publishing anything that could be deemed harmful to our economy. This is against democracy, undermines journalism and its role of checking powers.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/02/11/journalists-obtain-leaked-official-material-could-sent-prison/

attributes.action: Make stolen motorcycle information freely available to the public.
attributes.background: Information pertaining to stolen powered two wheelers should be freely available. Registration numbers, VIN numbers and engine numbers of all vehicles reported stolen should be available on a free to use Government website with the aim of reducing theft by making stolen PTW's harder to sell.
attributes.additional_details: In the period Jan-15 to Mar-15, 6574 PTW's were reported as stolen (source www.met.police.uk/foi/pdfs/disclosure_2016/may_2016/2016030001373.pdf)  Many of these, especially in the London area have been used in robberies of individuals and shops.  As information on stolen PTW's is already available on pay to use sources, I would like to request that information held by Govt. agencies regarding theft status, colour changes and insurance history (e.g. write offs) be made freely available.

attributes.action: Referendum for the public to decide how the pension age should be set
attributes.background: The government has decided the pension age should be increased due to people living longer, the public have had no say in this so I would suggest a referendum to decide what a fair pensionable age would be in the U.K.

attributes.action: Stop variable speed limits on motorways
attributes.background: The cameras on motorways are just there to raise money not to stop accidents drivers spend more time watching there speed than driving and watching the road
attributes.additional_details: There are over 1000 speed camera fines issued per day bringing in millions for the country but doing nothing for road safety
